body_html:
s = torch.Size([1, 2, 3])
torch.tensor(s)

No, in this example I would like to get a 1D tensor with values [1,2,3].

I get the return value tensor([1, 2, 3]), which is shape torch.Size([3]). Is this not what you're looking for?

@nwly Sorry, this works. I misread it the first time and used torch.Tensor.
body_text:
s = torch.Size([1, 2, 3])
torch.tensor(s)

No, in this example I would like to get a 1D tensor with values [1,2,3].

I get the return value tensor([1, 2, 3]), which is shape torch.Size([3]). Is this not what you're looking for?

@nwly Sorry, this works. I misread it the first time and used torch.Tensor.
body:
>>>`s = torch.Size([1, 2, 3])`
>>>`torch.tensor(s)`
>>
>>No, in this example I would like to get a 1D tensor with values [1,2,3].
>
>I get the return value tensor([1, 2, 3]), which is shape torch.Size([3]). Is this not what you're looking for?

@nwly Sorry, this works. I misread it the first time and used `torch.Tensor`.
